title: Smart Savings: Digital Vaults & Goals

sections.title: Saving in the App
sections.content:
Modern apps make saving easy and automatic. 

- **Vaults / Pockets**: Special digital places to keep your money safe for the future.
- **Round-ups**: The app rounds your spending to the nearest euro and saves the change. (Example: Pay €2.80, the app saves €0.20).
- **Auto-save**: Sending money to your vault automatically every month.
- **Interest**: Extra money the bank pays you for keeping your savings with them.

sections.title: Grammar: 'Can' and 'Can't' for Savings
sections.content:
Use **Can** to talk about possibilities and **Can't** for limits.

- **Possibility**: *I **can** save €50 this month if I use round-ups.*
- **Ability**: *You **can** see your progress on the app dashboard.*
- **Limit**: *We **can't** spend the money in the vault; it is for the future.*

**Questions:**
- *Can I reach my goal?* Yes, you can!
- *Can the app save money automatically?* Yes, it can.

sections.title: Setting Financial Goals
sections.content:
A **Goal** is something you want to buy later.

- **Short-term Goal**: Buying a new video game or shoes next month.
- **Long-term Goal**: Saving for a car or a big trip in one year.
- **Progress Bar**: A visual line that shows how close you are to your goal.

objectives: Identify automated saving features like round-ups
Use 'can' and 'can't' to discuss savings and spending rules
Understand the difference between short-term and long-term goals
